intro: Epidendrum dialychilum subsp. peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian Epidendrum, is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) native to South America. It is characterized by its sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that support its foliage and flowers. The plant produces elongated, pendulous inflorescences bearing numerous small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical,革质 (leathery), and arranged in two ranks around the pseudobulbs. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
